bug.short_desc: 4.10.3-200: unable to set the wireless regulatory domain
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Tested in different platforms and wireless devices.
- kernel-4.9.14-200.fc25.x86_64 works flawlessly: # iw reg get global country ES: DFS-ETSI (2400 - 2483 @ 40), (N/A, 20), (N/A) (5150 - 5250 @ 80), (N/A, 23), (N/A), NO-OUTDOOR, AUTO-BW (5250 - 5350 @ 80), (N/A, 20), (0 ms), NO-OUTDOOR, DFS, AUTO-BW (5470 - 5725 @ 160), (N/A, 26), (0 ms), DFS (57000 - 66000 @ 2160), (N/A, 40), (N/A)
phy#0 country AW: DFS-ETSI (2402 - 2482 @ 40), (N/A, 20), (N/A) (5170 - 5250 @ 80), (N/A, 20), (N/A), AUTO-BW (5250 - 5330 @ 80), (N/A, 20), (0 ms), DFS, AUTO-BW (5490 - 5710 @ 160), (N/A, 27), (0 ms), DFS
- kernel-4.10.3-200.fc25.x86_64: # iw reg get global country 00: DFS-UNSET (2402 - 2472 @ 40), (6, 20), (N/A) (2457 - 2482 @ 20), (6, 20), (N/A), AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (2474 - 2494 @ 20), (6, 20), (N/A), NO-OFDM, PASSIVE-SCAN (5170 - 5250 @ 80), (6, 20), (N/A), AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (5250 - 5330 @ 80), (6, 20), (0 ms), DFS, AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (5490 - 5730 @ 160), (6, 20), (0 ms), DFS, PASSIVE-SCAN (5735 - 5835 @ 80), (6, 20), (N/A), PASSIVE-SCAN (57240 - 63720 @ 2160), (N/A, 0), (N/A)
Does running "iw reg set ES" manually change the output of "iw reg get"?

(In reply to John W. Linville from comment #1)
> Does running "iw reg set ES" manually change the output of "iw reg get"?
NO.
# iw reg set ES # iw reg get global country 00: DFS-UNSET (2402 - 2472 @ 40), (6, 20), (N/A) (2457 - 2482 @ 20), (6, 20), (N/A), AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (2474 - 2494 @ 20), (6, 20), (N/A), NO-OFDM, PASSIVE-SCAN (5170 - 5250 @ 80), (6, 20), (N/A), AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (5250 - 5330 @ 80), (6, 20), (0 ms), DFS, AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (5490 - 5730 @ 160), (6, 20), (0 ms), DFS, PASSIVE-SCAN (5735 - 5835 @ 80), (6, 20), (N/A), PASSIVE-SCAN (57240 - 63720 @ 2160), (N/A, 0), (N/A)
phy#1 country 00: DFS-UNSET (2402 - 2472 @ 40), (6, 20), (N/A) (2457 - 2482 @ 20), (6, 20), (N/A), AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (2474 - 2494 @ 20), (6, 20), (N/A), NO-OFDM, PASSIVE-SCAN (5170 - 5250 @ 80), (6, 20), (N/A), AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (5250 - 5330 @ 80), (6, 20), (0 ms), DFS, AUTO-BW, PASSIVE-SCAN (5490 - 5730 @ 160), (6, 20), (0 ms), DFS, PASSIVE-SCAN (5735 - 5835 @ 80), (6, 20), (N/A), PASSIVE-SCAN (57240 - 63720 @ 2160), (N/A, 0), (N/A)
Packages: kernel-4.10.4-200.fc25.x86_64 iw-4.9-1.fc25.x86_64 crda-3.18_2016.02.08-1.fc24.x86_64
BTW, It was confirmed by Larry: https://marc.info/?l=linux-wireless&m=148985891102096

Larry bisected to the patch below...
commit 2ae0f17df1cd52aafd1ab0415ea1f1dd56dc0e2a Author: Johannes Berg <johannes.berg@intel.com> Date: Mon Oct 24 14:40:04 2016 +0200
genetlink: use idr to track families

(In reply to John W. Linville from comment #3)
> Larry bisected to the patch below... > > commit 2ae0f17df1cd52aafd1ab0415ea1f1dd56dc0e2a > Author: Johannes Berg <johannes.berg@intel.com> > Date: Mon Oct 24 14:40:04 2016 +0200 > > genetlink: use idr to track families
Wrong commit. He's still working on it: https://marc.info/?l=linux-wireless&m=149003566410798

(In reply to Xose Vazquez Perez from comment #4)
> (In reply to John W. Linville from comment #3) > > > Larry bisected to the patch below... > > > > commit 2ae0f17df1cd52aafd1ab0415ea1f1dd56dc0e2a > > Author: Johannes Berg <johannes.berg@intel.com> > > Date: Mon Oct 24 14:40:04 2016 +0200 > > > > genetlink: use idr to track families > > Wrong commit. > He's still working on it: > https://marc.info/?l=linux-wireless&m=149003566410798
Larry was right, the commit with the bug is 2ae0f17df1cd52aafd1ab0415ea1f1dd56dc0e2a : https://marc.info/?l=linux-wireless&m=149019579325221
Patch from Stanislaw Gruszka: https://marc.info/?l=linux-wireless&m=149019533925013
